page.description: Used to do a wildcard selection in a list or checkbox.
page.syntax: List as C = A5_WildcardSelect(C choices ,C existingChoices [,C dialog_title [,C Caption ]])

argument.name: choices
argument.description: The search string to use. A search string may contain characters and wildcard characters. The "?" character substitutes for any single character. The "*" character substitutes for any series of characters.

argument.name: existingChoices
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of values.

page.discussion: The A5_WildcardSelect() function displays a dialog that accepts arguments and calls FILTER_STRING_SMATCH().

section.title: Example
section.description: This example initializes the list with "Red" and "Blue". After entering "g*", selecting Add to Existing Selections, and clicking OK, the function returns the initial colors plus all the color names beginning with "g".
section.example: dim list as C dim existing as C list = a5.Color_Enum() existing = "Red" + crlf() + "Blue" ? A5_WildcardSelect(list, existing, "Find Color", "Color Name") = Red Blue Gold Gray-80 Gray-50 Gray-40 Gray-25 Green White
